revised_title: Dielectric Coefficients of Various Gases and Compounds
tldr: The authors conducted experiments to measure the dielectric coefficients of various gases and compounds, including allene, allylene, butanes, butylenes, cyanogen, hydrogen cyanide, boron trifluoride, nitrogen trifluoride, and carbon tetrafluoride. They used a quartz microbalance and a modified apparatus to measure the densities and dielectric coefficients of these gases at different temperatures. The results provided insights into the physical properties and moments of these gases, which can be useful for understanding their behavior and potential applications.
